content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric functions <math alttext="x of t, equals, e raised to the 2 t power, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, e raised to the 4 t power, plus, e to the t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 minus, one fourth times e raised to the negative 3 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times e raised to the 2 t power, minus, one half times e raised to the negative t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times e raised to the 2 t power, plus, one fourth times e raised to the negative t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="16 times e raised to the 4 t power, plus, e to the t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 minus, one fourth times e raised to the negative 3 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
